title: Humza Yousaf to launch SNP's 2024 general election campaign
description: Humza Yousaf will launch the SNP’s general election campaign in Glasgow on Friday with a pitch to “wipe the Tories off the electoral map”. The First Minister will deliver a speech to party members at the Oran Mor bar and venue in the city’s west end.

title: Starmer rules out resurrecting HS2 northern leg if Labour wins election
description: Sir Keir Starmer appears to have ended hopes of Labour resurrecting HS2’s northern leg after saying the party would not commit to taking the line to Manchester if it wins the next election.

title: Rishi Sunak grants Labour permission to start access talks with civil service
description: Rishi Sunak has granted Sir Keir Starmer permission to start formal access talks with the civil service ahead of a general election this year.

title: When Post Office and Fujitsu bosses will face questions from MPs over Horizon scandal
description: The ITV drama Mr Bates vs the Post Office has catapulted the scandal back into the public eye and now the chief executives will face questioning

title: Rishi Sunak holds Cabinet meeting as US-UK airstrikes expected against Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen
description: RISHI Sunak is holding a Cabinet meeting tonight amid the on-going Red Sea attacks on the Navy. The discussion will focus on possible US-UK strikes against Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen,

title: Who does Rishi Sunak think he’s kidding with economic claims? - Yorkshire Post Letters
description: Does Rishi Sunak think we are all stupid? He said ‘I want to keep going, managing the economy well and cutting people's taxes.’ Is he serious? His management of the economy has been disastrous. Debt has gone up, though he said the reverse at the ...

title: PM Rishi Sunak briefs Cabinet amid speculation of strike over Red Sea Houthi attacks
description: Rishi Sunak is reportedly holding a full Cabinet call on Thursday evening amid mounting speculation that UK and Western allies could take action against Houthi rebels following attacks in the Red Sea.

title: Red Sea crisis: Which UK ships have been deployed to the area?
description: The Government is considering striking land targets in Yemen in a bid to stop attacks by Iranian-backed Houthi rebels on ships.

title: Don't forget us - infected blood victims call for justice
description: The infected blood scandal public inquiry has been running since 2017, victims want government to intervene just as they have in the post office | ITV News Granada

title: UK 'preparing action against Houthi rebels' as Rishi Sunak holds Cabinet meeting
description: Iran-backed Houthi rebels have claimed attacks on ships in the Red Sea, which they say are either linked to Israel or heading to Israeli ports. | ITV National News

description: These are the ships that have been deployed and which others may be sent there following Thursday night's developments.

title: Sunak prepares to announce UK strikes against Houthi forces in Yemen
description: In recent months, Houthi rebels in Yemen have been launching attacks on ships passing through the Red Sea - worrying the West.

title: UK and US prepare air strikes on Yemen rebels amid Red Sea attacks
description: It comes after Defence Secretary Grant Shapps warned retaliation was being considered after weeks of attacks by the Iran-backed Houthi rebels on ships in the Red Sea

title: Call for Paula Vennells to return £2.93m bonuses over post office scandal
description: Former Post Office boss Paula Vennells was not at home yesterday as calls grew for her to hand back £2.93million in bonuses paid during the scandal. Ms Vennells, 65, and retired husband John, 68, live in a £1.5million farmhouse set in half an acre of grounds in a pretty Bedfordshire village.

title: PM briefing cabinet as UK and US weigh action against Houthi rebels
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is due to brief his cabinet shortly about the the likelihood of British and US military strikes against the Houthis in Yemen. The PM will hold a conference call with the cabinet tonight, and other senior Westminster figures not in government are expecting to be briefed shortly after.

title: Middle East crisis live: UK cabinet meets to discuss possible strikes on Houthi rebels
description: Rishi Sunak holds cabinet call amid expectation of UK involvement in military strikes against Houthi rebel targets in Yemen

title: UK Cabinet considers potential military action against Yemen Houthi fighters
description: There are reports tonight that Rishi Sunak is about to hold a full cabinet call to discuss potential British and American military strikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen. The National Security council met earlier today. Shipments through the Red Sea have been on hold, amid a series of attacks on commercial vessels by Houthis.

title: Exclusive: Prime Minister urged to reverse disability decision in open letter from ParalympicsGB and 56 sporting organisations
description: With this one decision the Government have stated that 24 per cent of the population are not a priority and do not need to have their voices heard"

title: CPS involved in up to 99 Post Office convictions, leaked letter shows
description: The Crown Prosecution Service has admitted it may have been involved in 99 Post Office prosecutions involving the defective Horizon IT system, according to a leaked letter seen by The Telegraph.

title: UK government admits Rwanda has ‘issues with its human rights record’
description: Assessment comes despite claims by Rishi Sunak that Rwanda is safe when making case for asylum policy The government has admitted that Rwanda still has “issues with its human rights record” despite claims by Rishi Sunak that it is a safe country.

title: George Osborne predicts date of next general election
description: Former chancellor and Sunak ally tells voters which date to save after being informed that it has been worked into No 10 plans

title: Sunak grants Labour permission to start access talks with civil service
description: Rishi Sunak has granted Sir Keir Starmer permission to start formal access talks with the civil service ahead of a general election this year. The meetings will be an opportunity for Labour to discuss its agenda for government and establish relationships with potential future colleagues in Whitehall.

title: Rishi Sunak fought to keep migrants in hotels as Chancellor rather than build large-scale camps
description: RISHI Sunak fought to keep migrants in hotels as Chancellor rather than build large-scale camps, The Sun can reveal. Leaked documents from 2022 show officials complaining he was “refusing to fund”

title: Cabinet thought to be due to discuss UK and US military action against Yemen's Houthi fighters
description: Rishi Sunak is due to hold a full cabinet call this evening which is thought to be about UK and US military strikes against Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title: Chilling mystery of 8-year-old boy who vanished on Charles and Diana's wedding day
description: On July 29, 1981, eight-year-old Vishal Mehrotra joined countless other Londoners who had headed out to watch the wedding procession of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer. He never returned home

title: No small boats have crossed the Channel for 25 days – the longest break since 2020
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has made stopping the boats one of his key pledges, but he was dealt a blow last week when leaked figures revealed the number of migrants crossing the Channel could rise to 35,000 this year. The leaked Border Force documents ...
